intro: Fagara integrifoliola, commonly known as the smooth-leaved fagara, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, entire leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round berries. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
